description.narrative: To increase the use of a defined package of health services by pregnant women, children under the age of five and couples ofreproductive age.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :FA and GA, Schedule 2, Section V.A(1): Results Based Financing | Description :The Recipient shall, throughoutProject implementation, set forth measures to ensure post- Project sustainability of the Free Package of Health Services inaccordance with the guidance provided in the Results-Based Financing Procedures Manual. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :FA and GA, Schedule 2, Section V.A(1): Results Based Financing | Description :Beginning in the Fiscal Year 2015through the end of Project implementation, maintain its allocation to the annual budget of the MPH for the provision of the FreePackage of Health Services to pregnant women and children under five at no less than 1.4 percent (1.4%) of the Recipient's totalbudget expenditures as approved under the Recipient's Budget Law of the applicable year. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :FA and GA, Schedule 2, Section V.A(1): Results Based Financing | Description :The Recipient shall on asemi-annual basis, upon agreement with IDA, fix the minimum payment percentage of Category 1 from the Grant and the CounterpartFunds to be allocated to Health Centers providing services under the Free Package of Health Services. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :FA and GA, Schedule 2, Section V.B(1)- (3) : Counterpart Funding | Description :Ensure that all amountsdeposited in the Counterpart Funds Account shall be used exclusively to pay for Eligible Expenditures required for Part 1(a) of theProject. | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :FA and GA, Schedule 2, Section V.B(1)- (3) : Counterpart Funding | Description :Maintain in the Bank of theRepublic of Burundi, at all times throughout Project implementation, on terms and conditions acceptableto IDA, the CounterpartFunds Account into which it shall deposit all such allocation referred to in paragraph (A)(1) of this Section V (“Counterpart FundsAccount”). | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :FA and GA, Schedule 2, Section V.B(1)- (3) : Counterpart Funding | Description :No later than end of February,April, June, and August of the relevant Fiscal Year, after the allocation of the percentage of its general expenditures to thebudget of the Min of Public Health and Fight Against HIV/AIDS, deposit into the Counterpart Funds Account, an amount in theRecipient's currency, equivalent to twenty (25) percent of such budget allocation for each respective period listed above |Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :FA and GA, Schedule 2, Section V.C(2) :Others | Description :No later than six (6) months after the EffectiveDate, the Recipient has submitted to the Association a progress report, satisfactory to the Association, detailing the status ofimplementation of the Instruction Letter. | Due Date :08-Oct-2013

Finance Agreement :FA and GA, Schedule 2, Section V.C(3) :Others | Description :Throughout Project implementation, carry out thetraining program referred to in Section V.E (a) of Schedule 2 to the First AF Agreement, for all staff involved in procurementprocessing within the MPH, in a manner acceptable to IDA. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :FA and GA, Schedule 2, Section V.C(4) :Others | Description :Throughout Project implementation, maintain theprocurement complaint management system within the MPH, as referred to in Section V.E (b) of Schedule 2 to the First AF Agreement,in a manner acceptable to the Association. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :FA and GA, Schedule 2, Section V.C(5) :Others | Description :Ensure that the Financing shall be used exclusivelyfor the financing of activities detailed in Schedule 1 of this Agreement and noportion of the Financing shall be used for anyapplicable expenditure under the Project if such expenditure was reimbursed by the Original grant or the First AF. | Frequency:Quarterly

Finance Agreement :FA and GA, Schedule 2,Section V.C(1) : Others | Description :No later than two (2) months after the EffectiveDate, the Recipient shall recruit in accordance with the provisions of Section III.C of this Schedule 2, a financial managementspecialist, with qualifications, experience and terms of reference acceptable to IDA. | Due Date :08-Jun-2013

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 Section I-E-5 | Description :Appoint or designate in the Directorate General of Health anenvironmental and social safeguard specialist, with qualifications, experience and TORs acceptable to IDA | Due Date :01-Nov-2009

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 Section II-B-2 | Description :Install in the Directorate General of Resources an information systemconfigured to interface with the accounting system of this Directorate. | Due Date :01-Nov-2009
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 Section II-B-5 | Description :Appoint external financial auditors, with qualifications, experienceand TORs acceptable to IDA | Due Date :01-Dec-2009

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2 Section V-A | Description :Throughout Project implementation, maintain the budget of the Ministry ofPublic Health for the provision of the Free Package of Health Services at no less than 1.4% of the general budget expenditures |Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section V.A(a)-(c) Other Undertakings: Results Based Financing | Description :On a semi-annualbasis, upon agreement with the World Bank, fix the minimum payment percentage of Category 1 from the Grant and theCounterpart Fundsto be allocated to Health Centers providing services under the Free Package of Health Services. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section V.A(a)-(c) Other Undertakings: Results Based Financing | Description :Throughout Projectimplementation, maintain its allocation to the budget of the Ministry of Public Health and Fight Against HIV/AIDS for the provisionof the Free Package of Health Services to pregnant women and children under five at no less than 1.4 percent (1.4%) of theRecipient's general budget expenditures outlined in the Recipient's second “Cadre StratEgique de Lutte Contre la PauvretE”. |Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section V.A(a)-(c) Other Undertakings: Results Based Financing | Description :Throughout Projectimplementation, set forth measures to ensure sustainability of the Free Package of Health Services in accordancewith the guidanceprovided in the Results-Based Financing Procedures Manual. | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section V.B(a) Other Undertakings: Counterpart Funding | Description :Maintain in the Bank of theRepublic of Burundi, at all times throughout the Project period, on terms and conditions acceptable to the World Bank, theCounterpart Funds Account into which it shall deposit all such allocation for the implementation of activities under Part 1 of theProject (“Counterpart Funds Account”). | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section V.B(a) Other Undertakings: Counterpart Funding | Description :Without limitation upon theprovisions of Section 2.01(b) of the Standard Conditions, deposit into the Counterpart Funds Account, an amount in the Recipient'scurrency, equivalent to the percentage of budget allocation required under Part A of this Section V. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section V.C(a): Annual Work Plans and Budgets | Description :Furnish to the World Bank for approvalas soon as available, but in any case not later than November 30 of each year, the annual work plan and budget for the Project foreach subsequent year of Project implementation, of such scope and detail as the World Bank shall have reasonably requested, exceptfor the annual work plan and budget for the first year of Project. | Due Date :23-Nov-2012

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section V.D: Semi-Annual Reviews | Description :Review with the World Bank, not later than one monthafter the transmittal to the World Bank of every Project Report referred to inSection II.A.1 of Schedule 2, or such later date asthe World Bank shall request, said Project Report, and, thereafter, take all measures required to ensure the efficient completionof the Project and the achievement of the objective thereof. | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section V.E | Description :Ensure that the Financing shall be used exclusively for the financing ofactivities detailed in Schedule 1 of this Agreement and noportion of the Financing shall be used for any applicable expenditureunder the Project if such expenditure was reimbursed by the Original Grant. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section V.E | Description :Not later than April 15, 2013, the Recipient shall establish aprocurement complaint management system, acceptable to the World Bank, within the Ministry of Public Health and Fight AgainstHIV/AIDS, and shall maintain such system throughout Project implementation. | Due Date :15-Apr-2013

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section V.E: | Description :Not later than December 15, 2012, the Recipient shall prepare a trainingprogram, satisfactory to the World Bank, for all staff involved in procurement processing within the Ministry of Public Health andFight Against HIV/AIDS, to be carried out throughout Project implementation. | Due Date :15-Dec-2012

title.narrative: Pregnant/lactating women, adolescent girls and/or children under age five-reached by basic nutrition services (number)
Percentage of health facilities that have a Head with A2 Level
Average number of visits to a health provider by children under the age of 5
Children between the age of 6 and 59 months receiving Vitamin A supplementation (number)
Number of pregnant women living with HIV who received antiretrovirals to reduce the risk of Mother To Child Transmission
Births (deliveries) attended by skilled health personnel (number)
Number of couple-years of contraceptive protection using modern methods
Children immunized - under 12 months against DTP3 (number)
Pregnant women receiving antenatal care during a visit to a health provider (number)
Coverage of prenatal care services for pregnant women (at least 3 visits)
Percentage of births assisted by skilled personnel
Children under age five treated for moderate or severe acute malnutrition (number)
Percentage of health facilities that did run out of essential drugs in the previous month
Percent of public and non-profit health facilities offering the free package of services through the RBF system
